what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Este meetup ofrece una visión general del flujo de trabajo para el desarrollo de paquetes, con un enfoque en las pruebas unitarias y CI/CD.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Un paquete es un conjunto de convenciones para organizar tu código y los artefactos relacionados: si sigues esas convenciones, obtienes un montón de herramientas gratis. – https://mastering-shiny.org/scaling-packaging.html

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Científicos de datos con algo de experiencia escribiendo código y funciones en R, pero con poca o ninguna experiencia en el desarrollo de paquetes en R.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Crear y chequear la infraestructura básica de un paquete: Crear un paquete en R. Chequear la estructura y corregir problemas. Crear un checklist de infraestructura adicional considerar. Documentar el “home page”, con el objetivo, installación y ejemplo. Configurar checks de estructura en GitHub. Configurar el despliege del website en GitHub. Crear y probar una función simple: Crear una función simple. Reportar la cobertura. Probarla. Documentarla. Chequear la estructura y corregir problemas. Chequear el website localmente. Mostrar otras cosas que hicimos pero que podemos cubrir hoy: Check de integración para una dependencias reversa. El formato “incubadora”.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: https://r-pkgs.org/whole-game.html#review

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: En vivo.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Paquete usethis para crear paquetes y mucho mas. Workflows para trabajar con R: r-lib/actions/examples. R packages (2e). Worflow personalizado para checkear la integracion con una dependencia reversa: ejemplo. El formato “incubadora” (template).

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: meetup provides overview workflow package development, focusing unit testing CI/CD.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: package set conventions organizing code related artifacts: follow conventions, get bunch free tools. – https://mastering-shiny.org/scaling-packaging.html

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Data scientists experience writing code functions R, little experience R package development.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Create check basic infrastructure package: Create package R. Check structure fix issues. Create checklist additional infrastructure consider. Document “home page,” including aim, installation, example. Set structure checks GitHub. Set deployment website GitHub. Create test simple function: Create simple function. Report coverage. Test . Document . Check structure fix issues. Check website locally. Show things ’ve done cover today: Integration check reverse dependencies. “incubator” format.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: https://r-pkgs.org/whole-game.html#review

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Live.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Package usethis creating packages much . Workflows working R: r-lib/actions/examples. R packages (2e). Custom workflow check integration reverse dependency: example. “incubator” format (template).

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: developer want setup fresh system can use devtools workflow develop R package. R package fresh environment (e.g. GitHub Codespaces): Install R: https://github.com/r-lib/rig Ensure start R blank slate: Install R-package dependencies: pak::pak() Install devtools: pak::pak("devtools") Setup devtools: usethis::use_devtools() Quit R R console: q() Start R terminal: R Setup devtools workflow aliases, run alias ther terminal, e.g. rtest run task extension, run task terminal, e.g. task test. tasks see Taskfile.yml
code: # ~/.bash_aliases alias R="R --no-save --no-restore-data" # .Rprofile if (interactive()) {   suppressMessages(require(devtools)) } # ~/.bash_aliases  alias rtest="Rscript -e 'devtools::test()'" alias rdocument="Rscript -e 'devtools::document()'" alias rcheck="Rscript -e 'devtools::check()'" # Taskfile.yml version: '3'  tasks:   test:     cmds:       - Rscript -e "devtools::test()"   document:     cmds:       - Rscript -e "devtools::document()"   check:     cmds:       - Rscript -e "devtools::check()"
